Package de.thkoeln.cvogt.android.propanim_utilities

Class AnimationViewCV

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.RelativeLayout
          • de.thkoeln.cvogt.android.propanim_utilities.AnimationViewCV
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent
    public class AnimationViewCV
extends android.widget.RelativeLayout
    ViewGroup class to display animated objects of class AnimatedGuiObjectCV (i.e. animated Drawable and View objects) with.
    For more comments on how to proceed, see the documentation of the class AnimatedGuiObjectCV.

    N.B.: Views of this class can currently not be embedded in a layout together with other views. Neither can this class be referenced in an XML layout file. You must therefore generate an object of this class in the Java code of an activity by calling the constructor specified below and then display the object fullscreen by passing it as a parameter to setContentView().

    A video explanation is given here: Overview, Code, Demo

    The code in the companion package de.thkoeln.cvogt.android.propanimutil_demos demonstrates how to use this class.


    This work is provided by Prof. Dr. Carsten Vogt, Technische Hochschule Köln, Fakultät für Informations-, Medien- und Elektrotechnik, Germany

    under GPLv3, the GNU General Public License 3, http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html.

    See Also:
    AnimatedGuiObjectCV, de.thkoeln.cvogt.android.propanimutil_demos

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  AnimationViewCV.CollisionHandler
      Interface for classes to handle collisions between animated objects.
      static class  AnimationViewCV.GestureListener
      Class for gesture listeners that can be registered with an AnimationViewCV object and that will be called by its gesture detector when a gesture is detected.
      static interface  AnimationViewCV.OnTouchListener
      Interface for Listeners that can be registered with an AnimationViewCV object and that will be called when a touch event occurs on this object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AnimationViewCV​(android.content.Context context)
      Constructor: Generates an empty list for 'guiObjects' and sets the OnTouchListener, the GestureDetector, and the GestureListener to null.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addAnimatedGuiObject​(AnimatedGuiObjectCV animatedGuiObject)
      Adds an animated object to 'guiObjects' (provided it is not already included in 'guiObjects', i.e. there will be no duplicates).
      void addAnimatedGuiObjects​(AnimatedGuiObjectsGroupCV animatedGuiObjectsGroup)
      Adds all animated objects of a group to 'guiObjects'.
      void addAnimatedGuiObjects​(java.util.ArrayList<AnimatedGuiObjectCV> animatedGuiObjects)
      Adds all animated objects of an ArrayList to 'guiObjects'.
      java.util.ArrayList<AnimatedGuiObjectCV> getAnimatedGuiObjects()
      Returns an ArrayList with all animated objects registered with this view.
      java.util.ArrayList<AnimatedGuiObjectCV> getAnimatedGuiObjectsAtPoint​(int x, int y)
      Returns the AnimatedGuiObjectCV objects whose enclosing rectangle contains a given point.
      java.util.ArrayList<AnimatedGuiObjectCV> getAnimatedGuiObjectsInArea​(int left, int top, int right, int bottom)
      Returns the AnimatedGuiObjectCV objects that lie (partly or completely) within a given rectangle.
      protected void onDraw​(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
      Is called automatically by the runtime system when the view is to be drawn.
      boolean onTouchEvent​(android.view.MotionEvent event)
      Is called automatically by the runtime system when a touch event occurs.
      void removeAllAnimatedGuiObjects()
      Removes all animated objects from 'guiObjects' and stops their animations.
      void removeAnimatedGuiObject​(AnimatedGuiObjectCV animatedGuiObject)
      Removes an animated object from 'guiObjects' and stops all its animations.
      void removeAnimatedGuiObjects​(AnimatedGuiObjectsGroupCV animatedGuiObjectsGroup)
      Removes all animated objects of a group from 'guiObjects' and stops all their animations.
      void removeGestureListener()
      Remove the GestureListener.
      void removeOnTouchListener()
      Remove the OnTouchListener.
      void setGestureListener​(AnimationViewCV.GestureListener gestureListener)
      Set the GestureListener.
      void setOnTouchListener​(AnimationViewCV.OnTouchListener onTouchListener)
      Set the OnTouchListener.
      void sortAnimatedGuiObjectsByZindex()
      Sorts an ArrayList with animated objects according to their z index values.
      void startAnimations()
      Start the animations of all objects in 'guiObjects' immediately.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnimationViewCV

        public AnimationViewCV​(android.content.Context context)
        Constructor: Generates an empty list for 'guiObjects' and sets the OnTouchListener, the GestureDetector, and the GestureListener to null.

    • Method Detail

      • onDraw

        protected void onDraw​(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        Is called automatically by the runtime system when the view is to be drawn. Calls in turn the draw() methods of all objects in 'guiObjects' that contain Drawable objects. All embedded View objects are drawn automatically (see comment for method addAnimatedGuiObject()).
        Overrides:
        onDraw in class android.view.View

      • getAnimatedGuiObjects

        public java.util.ArrayList<AnimatedGuiObjectCV> getAnimatedGuiObjects()
        Returns an ArrayList with all animated objects registered with this view. The objects are sorted by their z values; the object with the highest value (i.e. the object that will be drawn on top) standing at the end of the list.
        Returns:
        A copy of the guiObjects ArrayList

      • getAnimatedGuiObjectsAtPoint

        public java.util.ArrayList<AnimatedGuiObjectCV> getAnimatedGuiObjectsAtPoint​(int x,
                                                                             int y)
        Returns the AnimatedGuiObjectCV objects whose enclosing rectangle contains a given point. The objects are ordered by their z values; the object with the highest value (i.e. the object that will be drawn on top) is the last object in this list.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the point
        y - Y coordinate of the point
        Returns:
        The AnimatedDrawableAndViewsCV objects enclosing the point

      • getAnimatedGuiObjectsInArea

        public java.util.ArrayList<AnimatedGuiObjectCV> getAnimatedGuiObjectsInArea​(int left,
                                                                            int top,
                                                                            int right,
                                                                            int bottom)
        Returns the AnimatedGuiObjectCV objects that lie (partly or completely) within a given rectangle. The objects are ordered by their z values; the object with the highest value (i.e. the object that will be drawn on top) is the last object in this list.
        Parameters:
        left - left bound of the rectangle
        top - upper bound of the rectangle
        right - right bound of the rectangle
        bottom - bottom bound of the rectangle
        Returns:
        The AnimatedDrawableAndViewsCV objects within the rectangle

      • addAnimatedGuiObject

        public void addAnimatedGuiObject​(AnimatedGuiObjectCV animatedGuiObject)
        Adds an animated object to 'guiObjects' (provided it is not already included in 'guiObjects', i.e. there will be no duplicates). If the embedded object is of class View, it is also added to the layout of this displaying view such that it will be drawn automatically to the screen.

      • addAnimatedGuiObjects

        public void addAnimatedGuiObjects​(java.util.ArrayList<AnimatedGuiObjectCV> animatedGuiObjects)
        Adds all animated objects of an ArrayList to 'guiObjects'. If the embedded object is of class View, it is also added to the layout of this displaying view such that it will be drawn automatically to the screen.

      • addAnimatedGuiObjects

        public void addAnimatedGuiObjects​(AnimatedGuiObjectsGroupCV animatedGuiObjectsGroup)
        Adds all animated objects of a group to 'guiObjects'. If the embedded object is of class View, it is also added to the layout of this displaying view such that it will be drawn automatically to the screen.

      • removeAnimatedGuiObject

        public void removeAnimatedGuiObject​(AnimatedGuiObjectCV animatedGuiObject)
        Removes an animated object from 'guiObjects' and stops all its animations. If the embedded object is of class View, it is also removed from the layout of this displaying view.

      • removeAnimatedGuiObjects

        public void removeAnimatedGuiObjects​(AnimatedGuiObjectsGroupCV animatedGuiObjectsGroup)
        Removes all animated objects of a group from 'guiObjects' and stops all their animations. If there are embedded objects of class View, they is also removed from the layout of this displaying view.

      • removeAllAnimatedGuiObjects

        public void removeAllAnimatedGuiObjects()
        Removes all animated objects from 'guiObjects' and stops their animations. If the embedded object of an animated object is of class View, it is also removed from the layout of this displaying view.

      • sortAnimatedGuiObjectsByZindex

        public void sortAnimatedGuiObjectsByZindex()
        Sorts an ArrayList with animated objects according to their z index values. Is called automatically by the setZindex() methods of all registered animated objects and by the addAnimatedGuiObject() method of this class.

      • startAnimations

        public void startAnimations()
        Start the animations of all objects in 'guiObjects' immediately.

      • setOnTouchListener

        public void setOnTouchListener​(AnimationViewCV.OnTouchListener onTouchListener)
        Set the OnTouchListener.

      • removeOnTouchListener

        public void removeOnTouchListener()
        Remove the OnTouchListener.

      • setGestureListener

        public void setGestureListener​(AnimationViewCV.GestureListener gestureListener)
        Set the GestureListener. The corresponding gesture detector will be enabled for long press and double tap gestures.

      • removeGestureListener

        public void removeGestureListener()
        Remove the GestureListener.

      • onTouchEvent

        public boolean onTouchEvent​(android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Is called automatically by the runtime system when a touch event occurs. Calls in turn the onTouchEvent method of the superclass and notifies the registered gesture detector (if any). Calls the onTouch() method of the registered OnTouchListener (if any), passing this view, the GUI object touched and the MotionEvent object that describes the event. If multiple GUI objects are affected by the touch event, onTouch() is called for each of these objects. If there is no GUI object at the position touched, onTouch() is called once with null for the GUI object parameter.
        Overrides:
        onTouchEvent in class android.view.View
